Description:
Intelcom Express, a growing Quebec company in the e-commerce delivery sector. Our teams across Canada as well as our network of delivery partners contribute to the smooth running of daily activities.
Our goal is simple:
in a constantly changing industry, we don't just follow. We are getting ahead.
And we set ourselves apart with innovative services and delivery methods.
In order to continue our momentum, we are looking for an Accounting Technician. Working in the Financial Operations division, the candidate will support both the Payables and Receivables departments. The individual will also be required to liaise with various teams and divisions outside of Canada.
What will your day-to-day look like?
Receivables
Verify waybills and other documentation to prepare/validate invoicing for various clients
Ensure clients receive invoices and follow up to resolve invoicing corrections
Validate payment files used to process Broker Compensation payments
Record and post deposits
Prepare sub-lease and skid invoices
Resolve customer questions and inquires
Support the analysis of invoicing and receivables entries
Ensure accurate and timely storage of billing documentation
Validate Linehaul invoices to ensure compliance with Intelcom billing procedures
Prepare ad hoc reports and analysis as required by the Receivables Supervisor
Payables
Respond to external vendors and internal managers on all aspects of the accounts
payable process including processing invoices for payment, recording sales tax, assisting
with bank reconciliations, and loan documentation.
Research information to provide timely and accurate solutions to internal customers and
vendors across our locations.
Verify accuracy of vendor invoices and confirm appropriate general ledger account
codes are used.
Generate payments to vendors on a routine schedule
Inspect paid and unpaid invoices, including cleared payment requests. Verify
adjustments to records to ensure information and procedures are accurate in
accordance with company standards.
Review automatic payments to ensure information and processing is accurate and
properly documented.
Develop and maintain a filing system for financial information, records and documents to
ensure optimal availability of information.
Monitor account balances, track expenses, prepare account analyses and related
financial activities to produce monthly financial reports.
This makes you an ideal candidate:
Diploma in accounting, management or finance or similar qualifications;
Minimum of five (5) years of experience in accounting and month end close in a large company operating several different sites and legal entities;
Excellent planning, strategy and analytical skills;
Bilingualism (French and English), both oral and written;
Advanced Excel and strong ability to adapt with financial systems;
Highly developed sense of organization and keen sense of urgency;
Ability to work under pressure and ease in managing priorities with minimal supervision;
At Intelcom, we encourage initiative and value creation through participatory projects and an open culture. Together, we build a knowledge sharing community and develop many collaborative projects to offer a personalized and flexible delivery service.
